00001 #pragma once
00002 #include "Utils.h"
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #include <stdio.h>
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 using namespace std;
00007 
00008 //This class manages an edge in the graph
00009 //It has getters to all the relevant fields such as capacity, end point etc.
00010 //It also holds pointers to the next and previous edges (thus arranging them in a doubly linked list
00011 //Most getters are set as inline functions since there are many calls to them and we want to avoid
00012 //straining the call stack
00013 class EdgeEntry
00014 {
00015 public:
00016         void push(int value);
00017 
00018         inline int getEndPoint() { return endPoint; }
00019         inline int getCapacity() { return capacity; }
00020         inline void incCapacity(int value) { capacity += value; }
00021         inline void incFlow(signed int value) { flow += value; }
00022         inline int getFlow() { return flow; }
00023         inline bool isSaturated() { return (flow == capacity); }
00024         inline int getResCapacity() { return (capacity - flow); }       
00025 
00026         inline EdgeEntry* getNext() { return nextEdge; }
00027         inline EdgeEntry* getPrev() { return prevEdge; }
00028         inline EdgeEntry* getReverse() { return reverseEdge; }
00029 
00030         void setReversed(EdgeEntry* other);
00031         bool isReverseEdge();
00032 
00033         EdgeEntry(int end, int cap, int flow, EdgeEntry* prev);
00034         EdgeEntry *nextEdge;
00035     EdgeEntry *prevEdge;
00036 
00037 private:
00038         int endPoint;
00039     int capacity; 
00040     signed int flow;     
00041         EdgeEntry *reverseEdge; //the reversed edge
00042 };
